intro: Stylidium serrulatum, commonly known as the serrulate triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that resemble small triggers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique floral structure is adapted for pollination by specific insect species, particularly flies. Stylidium serrulatum is often found in coastal and inland regions, showcasing its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
